intro: Pseudodictamnus, commonly known as false dittany, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Pseudodictamnus species are perennial herbs that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. They are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa, where they play a role in local ecosystems.
